name: Los Angeles Airport Marriott

reviews.text: I stayed here for one Friday night on business. Arrived at 10 pm and hotel reception was packed with flight crews and people who missed flights. The front desk processed the line very fast. The room was a typical Marriott - clean and comfortable. Dinner at Champions Sports Bar was typical pub fare. Service was excellent. Free airport shuttle to forever to get to the hotel from the airport due to the number of stops it had to make.
reviews.title: OK Airport Hotel

reviews.text: At $160.00/night, you'd think this "five star" hotel would be giving free foot massages the minute you check in. Well, what can I say? Aside from being only two blocks from LAX, it's an overpriced dinosaur sticking up in the California skyline... this hotel is so old, I'm half expecting to see Jayne Mansfield pull up to the front door in a 1961 Edsel. The good: friendly staff. The bad: OVERFRIKINPRICED!!! You know, that you have to pay $13 bucks a day just to check your email bugs me. That you have to pay $30 bucks a day to park a car (park at one of the MANY nearby airport parking lots, WAYYYYY cheaper) is laughable. The sports bar called "Champions" should be called "Shack du $8 Coors and Baskets of Grease we call food". It should be standard inexpensive pub fare, but no.... it doesn't matter what you eat in there, you can expect a minimum of a $20.00 charge/person/meal/perhaps. The Steakhouse smells great, too bad you can't afford to change your mind if you decide to fork out $38 bucks for an $8 dollar strip loin. Breakfast in Latitude 33 is $12.95 or GASP $16.95 for the buffet... all designed to upsell your order.
reviews.title: Overpriced and Dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms: fairly moderinish, although the colours are basically brown and rust. Small TV's with the most BASIC of cable available. Bathroom is nicely appointed but the tub might as well be a galvanized steel basin, it's that small! Maids come in around 10:00 am and while they don't steal anything, they don't exactly clean the place up other than make the bed, dump the trash cans and vacuum. I still have newspapers in my room where I left them three days ago and this is day five of my one week business trip. The windows are FILTHY times infinity. It's like someone splashed a bucket of swamp water on them and left the dirt to cake on for a week. NO excuse for that whatsoever.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: All told, the LAX Airport Marriott is a drab old building with a throw together facelift, insulting prices, crummy maid service and overpriced everything. Glad my company paid for this trip. If I am in LA again, I am staying at the Super 8.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel meets the normal Marriott quality standards. In comparison with other airport hotels, I would rate it above average in terms of cleanness of the rooms and silence. One advice: if you ask the Courtyard shuttle driver nicely (there is a seperate shuttle service for the Courtyard and the Marriott hotel), he might also drive you to the Marriott. This worked perfectly for us as we could directly catch the Courtyard shuttle when we left the terminal
reviews.title: Good Experience
The good, the very good, and the not so good
reviews.text: This will be the fifth year my husband and I have stayed at this hotel over the Thanksgiving weekend while we attend a small convention. I always enoy our stay, but this year the hotel seemed improved.

likes.liked: — I liked the exercise room and the pool area

reviews.text: The good: Our room had new carpeting and was bright and clean. While not huge, it was pleasant and quiet and had the standard amenities (Before you complain that there is no coffeemaker, look in the closet).
reviews.title: Good, quiet affordable hotel near LAX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very good: The exercise room now has at least eight treadmills, and each has an individual television monitor. They provide earbuds so you don't have to listen to your neighbor's program. There were also a variety of other exercise machines, and a separate alcove with weights. There were lots of clean towels, cold water, and apples. Definitely above average!
reviews.title: Convenient to LAX with adequate services.

likes.disliked: — Room service breakfast adequate but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not so good: It took us several hours to drive there, and when we arrived we were directed to underground parking. My husband drove around and around, looking for a space for his small truck, until he finally gave up and drove out again. When we told the attendant we couldn't find a place to park the attendant said "There are spaces there -- people are going in and not coming out." and directed us to the above-ground area, where the only place we could find had a tree branch obscuring it. Fortunately we're not car proud, so we just moved the branch aside and then let it rest against the truck.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: I guess if we had continued circling the underground garage we would have found a space eventually. Also there would have been space if there hadn't been at least two cars taking up two spaces apiece, and one truck that was taking up two and a half spaces. Also, some of the underground space was being used to store what looked like building supplies.
reviews.title: MARRIOTT LAX = BAD

likes.disliked: — The small rooms, expensive room rates and too many minor problems.

reviews.text: After long haul the beds very comfy rooms spacious and toiletrries special. The breakfast was a buffet with plenty of fresh fruit yoghurts home made granola(lovely) and lots of pastries + cooked breakfast if you wanted.
reviews.title: Comfy beds after long haul from London

likes.disliked: — Orange Juice in the morning - did not taste very nice

reviews.text: Stayed one night on way from London. Arrived at LAX at 7pm and after 2 hours to get through immigration I was glad the wait for the free shuttle to the hotel was not too long - about 10 minutes. Apparently one comes every 20 minutes. The driver was very courteous. Took longer getting around terminals than drive from airport to hotel. Check in very quick although lady at reception seemed to want to be anywhere else but working that night. Try a 12 hour flight from London! No assistance offered to bring cases to my room and the walk along the corridors seemed endless. The complex is two interconnected tower blocks and I found the walk exhausting, especially after a long flight and I am in my 30's. Very easy to get lost in the maze of bends. When I finally found my room it was clean and very comfortable, especially the bed. Bathroom on small side but all amenities and very clean. Unfortunately no bathrobe to change into and no mini bar/fridge for a cold drink. Do not recommend the buffet breakfast - very limited and the scrambled eggs tasted processed and dry. The waitress however was very friendly and helpful. Major suggestion: Do not make long distance calls from the hotel. - the rates are outrageous. The Starbucks in the lobby is a great bonus. The pool and garden area is like something out of the 60's - not very attractive and beware falling branches from the palm trees in high winds.
reviews.title: Forget the gym, the corridors will kill you!

reviews.text: The property itself is clean, well-presented and well-maintained. However, for an airport hotel, and a property which does a great deal
reviews.title: As long as you don't have a car or need internet access...

likes.liked: — Staff, late check out policy, prompt shuttle bus
likes.disliked: — Parking and internet charges, ground floor room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: of it's business with flight crews, it certainly does not go out of it's way to ensure that the crews are indulged.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Airport

likes.disliked: — $12.95 per day charge for internet access

reviews.text: We are Marriott Rewards customers (albeit the basic level), and were assigned a room on the ground floor - with a very narrow door, making
reviews.title: Check the charges

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for people who like to walk. You really get a workout when you try to find your room. Perhaps you’ll walk up and down and around several corners of the very attractive long hallways with nice carpet to get to your room. The hotel is shaped like a square with a center courtyard that includes the large swimming pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel, almost close to everything

likes.liked: — Close to LAX, close to freeway, bus to LAX terminal
likes.disliked: — No set schedule for free bus to LAX, might have 20 minute wait

reviews.title: Distaster Area at Hotel Cockamamee
reviews.text: Request a room with a balcony on the lower floors facing the pool. Higher floors facing the pool do not have a balcony. The rooms are small, but nice and include usual Marriott standards such as great bedding, work desks and lighting. The room had a nice TV, but the remote needed batteries.
Marriott still pushes that awful scented ginger smelling lotion and bathroom products. Some hotels will give guys a non-scented or the low-keyed almond scented product from the front desk.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...but very noisy air condition!

reviews.text: The property is close to the freeway. During rush hour forget trying to get anywhere fast. Mapquest told me it would take 21 minutes to get downtown. It took an hour ten minutes.
reviews.title: Good location to explore coastal area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has one of the best work-out facilities, including dozens of treadmills, stair masters, bikes, free weights and other good equipment. Treadmills have TV. New earplugs are provided.
reviews.title: beyond expectations

aka: Los Angeles Airport Marriott Hotel Los Angeles
